summary: The Federal Retirement Fairness Act (H.R. 1522) aims to amend Title 5 of the United States Code to allow civilian service in temporary positions after December 31, 1988, to be creditable service under the Federal Employees Retirement System (FERS). The bill clarifies eligibility for temporary employees, including those in the U.S. Postal Service and Members of Congress. The Office of Personnel Management will be responsible for notifying affected employees and creating regulations to implement the changes.
